There can only be one approved address per token at a given time. approved by a given owner.","params":{"operator":"operator address which you want to query the approval of","owner":"owner address which you want to query the approval of"},"return":"bool whether the given operator is approved by the given owner"},"makeBid(uint256,uint256)":{"details":"The bidder should only be able to submit a bid if the publication's pricing structure is an auction and the auction is runningBy default the bid will have a status of Pending until it is accepted or rejected by the authorIf the author has specified a flat rate, the buyer doesn't submit a bid but just sends the funds.The funds sent should match the sale price specified by the author.This 'bid' has a status of sale because the author does not need to evaluate and accept/reject these bids.Transfer Dai from buyer to sellerparameters of licence design: buyer_id, publication id, bid_id","params":{"_offer":"for the research","_publication_Id":"is the index for the publication Id"}},"name()":{"details":"Gets owner of"},"return":"address currently marked as the owner of the given token ID"},"registerUser(string)":{"details":"If the user's address is in position 0 of the userAddresses array, they are unregisteredCreate an instance of the user and add the Id to their address","params":{"_profile_uri":"user profile url"}},"rejectBid(uint256)":{"params":{"_id":"is the bid Id"}},"safeTransferFrom(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"Safely transfers the ownership of a given token ID to another address If the target address is a contract, it must implement `onERC721Received`, which is called upon a safe transfer, and return the magic value `bytes4(keccak256(\"onERC721Received(address,address,uint256,bytes)\"))`; otherwise, the transfer is reverted. Requires the msg.sender to be the owner, approved, or operator","params":{"from":"current owner of the token","to":"address to receive the ownership of the given token ID","tokenId":"uint256 ID of the token to be transferred"}},"safeTransferFrom(address,address,uint256,bytes)":{"details":"Safely transfers the ownership of a given token ID to another address If the target address is a contract, it must implement `onERC721Received`, which is called upon a safe transfer, and return the magic value `bytes4(keccak256(\"onERC721Received(address,address,uint256,bytes)\"))`; otherwise, the transfer is reverted. Requires the msg.sender to be the owner, approved, or operator","params":{"_data":"bytes data to send along with a safe transfer check","from":"current owner of the token","to":"address to receive the ownership of the given token ID","tokenId":"uint256 ID of the token to be transferred"}},"setApprovalForAll(address,bool)":{"details":"Sets or unsets the approval of a given operator An operator is allowed to transfer all tokens of the sender on their behalf.","params":{"approved":"representing the status of the approval to be set","to":"operator address to set the approval"}},"supportsInterface(bytes4)":{"details":"See `IERC165.supportsInterface`.     * Time complexity O(1), guaranteed to always use less than 30 000 gas."},"symbol()":{"details":"Gets the token symbol.","return":"string representing the token symbol"},"tokenURI(uint256)":{"details":"Returns an URI for a given token ID. Throws if the token ID does not exist. May return an empty string.","params":{"tokenId":"uint256 ID of the token to query"}},"transferFrom(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"Transfers the ownership of a given token ID to another address. Usage of this method is discouraged, use `safeTransferFrom` whenever possible. Requires the msg.sender to be the owner, approved, or operator.","params":{"from":"current owner of the token","to":"address to receive the ownership of the given token ID","tokenId":"uint256 ID of acceptBid(uint256).details: parameters of licence design: buyer_id, publication id, bid_id

approve(address,uint256).details: Approves another address to transfer the given token ID The zero address indicates there is no approved address. There can only be one approved address per token at a given time. Can only be called by the token owner or an approved operator.

params.to: address to be approved for the given token ID
params.tokenId: uint256 ID of the token to be approved

balanceOf(address).details: Gets the balance of the specified address.

params.owner: address to query the balance of

balanceOf(address).return: uint256 representing the amount owned by the passed address

constructor.details: The constructor below reserves user 0 for all unregistered users

createPublication(string,bool,bool,uint2.details: The researcher only specifies the flat rate if they have chosen not to auction the workAdd instance to the respective arrays

getApproved(uint256).details: Gets the approved address for a token ID, or zero if no address set Reverts if the token ID does not exist.

params.tokenId: uint256 ID of the token to query the approval of

getApproved(uint256).return: address currently approved for the given token ID

getBids(address).return: This function allows anyone to get the list of bids based on address of the user

getPublication(uint256).return: Returns information about a spesific publication ID

getPublicationBids(uint256).return: This function allows anyone to get list of bids per publication

getPublicationLength().return: This function allows the return of the total number of publications

getPublications(address).return: This function allows anyone to get the list of publications based on the address of the publisher

isApprovedForAll(address,address).details: Tells whether an operator is approved by a given owner.

params.operator: operator address which you want to query the approval of
params.owner: owner address which you want to query the approval of

isApprovedForAll(address,address).return: bool whether the given operator is approved by the given owner

makeBid(uint256,uint256).details: The bidder should only be able to submit a bid if the publication's pricing structure is an auction and the auction is runningBy default the bid will have a status of Pending until it is accepted or rejected by the authorIf the author has specified a flat rate, the buyer doesn't submit a bid but just sends the funds.The funds sent should match the sale price specified by the author.This 'bid' has a status of sale because the author does not need to evaluate and accept/reject these bids.Transfer Dai from buyer to sellerparameters of licence design: buyer_id, publication id, bid_id

params._publication_Id: is the index for the publication Id

ownerOf(uint256).details: Gets the owner of the specified token ID.

params.tokenId: uint256 ID of the token to query the owner of

ownerOf(uint256).return: address currently marked as the owner of the given token ID

registerUser(string).details: If the user's address is in position 0 of the userAddresses array, they are unregisteredCreate an instance of the user and add the Id to their address

safeTransferFrom(address,address,uint256.details: Safely transfers the ownership of a given token ID to another address If the target address is a contract, it must implement `onERC721Received`, which is called upon a safe transfer, and return the magic value `bytes4(keccak256("onERC721Received(address,address,uint256,bytes)"))`; otherwise, the transfer is reverted. Requires the msg.sender to be the owner, approved, or operator

params.to: address to receive the ownership of the given token ID
params.tokenId: uint256 ID of the token to be transferred

safeTransferFrom(address,address,uint256.details: Safely transfers the ownership of a given token ID to another address If the target address is a contract, it must implement `onERC721Received`, which is called upon a safe transfer, and return the magic value `bytes4(keccak256("onERC721Received(address,address,uint256,bytes)"))`; otherwise, the transfer is reverted. Requires the msg.sender to be the owner, approved, or operator

params._data: bytes data to send along with a safe transfer check
params.to: address to receive the ownership of the given token ID
params.tokenId: uint256 ID of the token to be transferred

setApprovalForAll(address,bool).details: Sets or unsets the approval of a given operator An operator is allowed to transfer all tokens of the sender on their behalf.

params.approved: representing the status of the approval to be set
params.to: operator address to set the approval

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: See `IERC165.supportsInterface`.     * Time complexity O(1), guaranteed to always use less than 30 000 gas.

tokenURI(uint256).details: Returns an URI for a given token ID. Throws if the token ID does not exist. May return an empty string.

params.tokenId: uint256 ID of the token to query

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: Transfers the ownership of a given token ID to another address. Usage of this method is discouraged, use `safeTransferFrom` whenever possible. Requires the msg.sender to be the owner, approved, or operator.

params.to: address to receive the ownership of the given token ID
params.tokenId: uint256 ID of the token to be transferred

acceptBid(uint256).notice: This function allows the auctioneer to accept the bidsThis function allows the auctioneer to reject the bids

cancelBid(uint256).notice: This function allows the auctioneer to cancel the bids

changeRunningStatus(uint256).notice: This function allows the auctioneer to change the running status

changeSellPrice(uint256,uint256).notice: This function allows the auctioneer to change the sell price

changeToAuction(uint256).notice: This function allows the auctioneer to change from a sale to an auction

changeToSale(uint256,uint256).notice: This function allows the auctioneer to change from an auction to a sale

createPublication(string,bool,bool,uint2.notice: This function creates a publication on the system, with blank arrays for publication bids and owners,since no one has bidded for or bought a licence yet

makeBid(uint256,uint256).notice: This function creates a new bid for a particular publication

registerUser(string).notice: This function registers a user on the platform by taking in their profile URL

rejectBid(uint256).notice: This function allows the auctioneer to reject the bids
